greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n>=0, 0<=k<=n) = number of partitions of n with exactly k kinds of 1's which are introduced in ascending order.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
example: T(3,2) = 3: 1a1a1b, 1a1b1a, 1a1b1b. (The two kinds of 1's are labeled 1a and 1b)
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i<2,
f(n, k), add(b(n-i*j, i-1, k), j=0..n/i))
b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i<2,
k^n, b(n, i-1, k) +b(n-i, min(i, n-i), k))
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 14}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 17 2018, translated from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal and first lower diagonal give: A000012, A000217.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 22 2017
ext: Definition clarified by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 12 2020
